Name: Amalia (by Robert Kalvans)
Ingredients: 50 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
10 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: MUDDLE basil in base of shaker. Add other ingredients, SHAKE with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and fine strain into chilled glass.
Review: Take a simple Daquiri and add apple juice, fresh basil and passion fruit syrup, plus a splash of egg white to give a foaming head, and you have an Amalia.
History: Adapted from the Latvian Bacardí Legacy 2014 winning cocktail created by Robert Kalvans at Cheers Bar in Riga, Latvia. Robert's original recipe called for 45ml Bacardi Carta Blanca, 20ml apple juice, 20ml passion fruit syrup, 15ml Lime juice, 10ml egg white, and 10 fresh basil leaves.
